<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 235, 176, 247]]<|/det|> NUMBER <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 349, 290]]<|/det|> # ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[834, 278, 905, 290]]<|/det|> 0606/21 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 302, 156, 313]]<|/det|> Paper 2 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 302, 907, 314]]<|/det|> October/November 2024 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 327, 907, 339]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 368]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 361, 397]]<|/det|> No additional materials are needed. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 224, 432]]<|/det|> # INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 292, 448]]<|/det|> · Answer **all** questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 761, 464]]<|/det|> · Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 480]]<|/det|> · Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 564, 495]]<|/det|> · Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 510]]<|/det|> · Do **not** use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 525]]<|/det|> · Do **not** write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 480, 541]]<|/det|> · You should use a calculator where appropriate. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 880, 572]]<|/det|> · You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 860, 603]]<|/det|> · Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 635, 214, 647]]<|/det|> # INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 651, 386, 664]]<|/det|> · The total mark for this paper is 80. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 667, 730, 681]]<|/det|> · The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[386, 870, 611, 883]]<|/det|> This document has **16** pages.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 88]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 133, 561, 151]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 165, 240, 183]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 194, 384, 212]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 212, 581, 248]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 271, 228, 288]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 289, 752, 330]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 345, 495, 380]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 410, 384, 428]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series \(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 432, 536, 465]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\left\{2a + (n - 1)d\right\}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 488, 336, 505]]<|/det|>
Geometric series \(u_{n} = ar^{n - 1}\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 508, 428, 579]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} (r\neq 1)\] \[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} (|r|< 1)\]  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 610, 594, 628]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 643, 156, 660]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 670, 583, 722]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc \sec^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 766, 242, 784]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 791, 593, 826]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 826, 594, 846]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 852, 556, 881]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[86, 73, 101, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 571, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\tan \theta + \cot \theta\) can be written as \(\sec \theta \cosec \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 99, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 79, 144, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 78, 728, 102]]<|/det|>
Given that \(y = \tan x - x\), find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\). Write your answer in terms of \(\tan x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 79, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[918, 79, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 465, 146, 484]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 457, 247, 484]]<|/det|>
Hence find \(\int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{4}} \tan^{2} x \mathrm{d}x\). Give your answer in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 465, 920, 484]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 82, 97, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 82, 144, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 82, 447, 101]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(8^{\frac{1}{x}} - 2 \times 8^{-\frac{1}{x}} = 1.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 375, 146, 393]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 373, 920, 410]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\left(a - \sqrt{3}\right)^2 = b + \left(3 - b\right)\sqrt{3}\) , where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers. Find the possible values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 392, 920, 410]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[306, 81, 688, 319]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 335, 920, 371]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the triangle \(OAC\). The point \(B\) lies on \(AC\) such that \(AB:BC = p:q\), where \(p\) and \(q\) are constants \((p \neq -q)\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 378, 448, 400]]<|/det|>
\[\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a}, \overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{b} \text{ and } \overrightarrow{OC} = \mathbf{c}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 422, 304, 453]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\mathbf{b} = \frac{q\mathbf{a} + p\mathbf{c}}{q + p}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 428, 917, 447]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[64, 79, 81, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 787, 106]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\log_a(p+1) + \frac{1}{\log_p a} - \log_a(p+2) + \log_a 5 = \log_a 12\), find the value of \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 77, 920, 96]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 433, 420, 452]]<|/det|>

<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = 2x \cos x\). The normal to the curve at \((\pi , - 2\pi)\) meets the \(x\)-axis and \(y\)-axis at points \(P\) and \(Q\). Find the exact area of triangle \(POQ\).

<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 920, 109]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A class contains 7 girls and 8 boys. A group of 6 is selected from the class. The group must contain at least 3 girls and at least 2 boys. Find the number of different groups that can be selected. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 349, 146, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 349, 667, 368]]<|/det|>
A 5-character code is to be formed from the following characters.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 380, 468, 399]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 411, 366, 428]]<|/det|>
Numbers 1 2 3

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 441, 920, 476]]<|/det|>
No character may be used more than once in any code. The characters may be arranged in any order.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 488, 808, 507]]<|/det|>

<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 146, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 468, 98]]<|/det|>
f(x) = \(\frac{x}{x - 1}\) for \(-10 \leqslant x \leqslant 10, x \neq 1.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 96, 487, 117]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\).

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 460, 725, 488]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 682, 920, 701]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 844, 665, 864]]<|/det|>
Question 12 is printed on the next page.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 102, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 801, 106]]<|/det|>
Two arithmetic progressions, \(A\) and \(B\), each have 100 terms. Their terms are denoted by \(a_1, a_2, a_3, a_4, \ldots a_{100}\) and \(b_1, b_2, b_3, b_4, \ldots b_{100}\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 116, 512, 138]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(a_1 = b_{100} = 1\) and \(a_{100} = b_1 = 298\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 149, 144, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 149, 393, 170]]<|/det|>
Find \(n\) such that \(a_n - b_n = 45\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 151, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 522, 146, 541]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 522, 475, 543]]<|/det|>
Find the smallest \(m\) such that \(a_m > 2b_m\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 523, 910, 541]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
